{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":2990581,"name":"UserWithAName","username":"UserWithAName","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/u/cdc98d/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-01-13T09:06:54.469Z","cooked":"

link: Desmos | Graphing Calculator

I’ve made a small calculator in Desmos, to calculate the angle [deg] and exit velocity [m/s] needed to hit the middle of the upper hub from a specified distance [m] , height [m] and angle [degrees].

image1920×1080 106 KB

“a”: shooting angle needed.
“v”: exit velocity needed.
“S”: the angle you want to hit the target in.
“d”: specified distance between the shooter and the middle of the upper hub at any time.
“H”: height difference between the shooter and the upper hub.
